alert.note: Alert for Nassau; Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 12:48AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Nassau and Suffolk. * WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1248 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to heavy showers and embedded thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area through 300am. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Levittown, Freeport, Huntington Station, Deer Park, Lindenhurst, Plainview, Massapequa, Syosset, Huntington, Westbury, Babylon, Farmingdale, Northport, Oyster Bay, Jones Beach, Hicksville, Dix Hills, Melville, Wantagh and Amityville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
